name: homologous
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
formal having a similar position, structure, value, or purpose: homologous to These activities are meant to be homologous to modern work conditions.homologous with A model represents, or is homologous with, a specific aspect of perceived reality.
biology
  specialized having the same origin although now having a different purpose or shape, usually as a result of evolution (= gradual change over millions of years): The wing of a bat and the arm of a man are homologous structures.homologous to A female's paraurethral glands are homologous to the male prostate.homologous with Feathers are traditionally considered homologous with reptilian scales.
biology
  specialized (of a chromosome) containing similar information to another chromosome that it forms a pair with during meiosis (= a type of cell division): In this case a pair of homologous chromosomes fail to separate from one another during meiosis.
